Text: How much do you do the following behaviours?
I take measures to reduce my carbon footprint.
I take measures to act in an environmentally friendly way.
I strive to behave sustainably.
I engage in discussions about the environment.
I engage with the climate movement by reading articles, watching videos and seeking knowledge on the topic.

I take measures to reduce my fuel consumption (e.g. when travelling I opt for car pools, cycling, public transport and walking when possible. If I use my car, I will reduce excessive fuel consumption by restricting use of radio and air-conditioning).

I take appropriate measures to reduce my energy consumption (by using energy saving light bulbs, turning lights off when leaving a room unattended, turning off electronic devices when not in use, reducing use of air-conditioning and fans, using energy efficient appliances, etc.).

I take appropriate measures to reduce energy consumption for heating (e.g. by keeping indoor temperature low, washing clothes at a lower temperature, wearing more clothes rather than using the heating, turning off heating in empty rooms etc.).
I have installed or am seriously considering installing solar panels for electricity, solar water heating and/or buying my household electricity on a Green Tariff.
I take as few flights as possible and offset those which I do take.

I reduce the amount of water I use (e.g. shorter showers, not running tap water unnecessarily during tooth-brushing and dish-washing, lowering frequency of dish-washer usage and toilet flushing, waiting for a full load before washing dishes and clothes, collecting rainwater, reducing or avoiding using sprinklers in the garden, using water stations for hydration rather than purchasing bottled water).
I decide not to buy something because I think it has too much packaging, or that its packaging is not eco-friendly/biodegradable.
I buy package free items (including cosmetics, toiletries, using refill stations, produce).
I buy products made from recycled materials.
I buy products made from sustainable, natural or biodegradable materials.
I recycle as much as I possibly can (newspapers, cans, plastics and glass).
I compost household food waste (my green kitchen waste is composted in the garden or at a municipal facility).
I reuse household waste items that would otherwise go in the bin (e.g. jars, bottles, gift wrap).
I purchase second-hand goods.
I buy and reuse items which have multiple uses (bags for life, reusable coffee cups/water bottles) and avoid single use items (such as disposable coffee cups, plastic bags, plastic water bottles).
I buy environmentally friendly alternatives to toxic products (e.g natural deodorant, organic produce) or avoid the chemical product altogether (e.g hairspray/growing own produce).
I eat food which is locally or home grown/farmed.
I eat food which is in season.
I actively look for recycling bins to dispose of recyclable items, including when I am out of my house and in public areas.
I take initiative to find sustainable ways to dispose of not-locally recycled waste (e.g. terracycling products that would otherwise be binned).
I buy fairtrade and/or sustainably sourced food.
I donate clothes and furniture to charity.
I reduce my food waste (donate food to charities, avoid buying too much food, home freezing etc.).
I limit or reduce my consumption of animal products (dairy, poultry, fish, etc.).
I eat sustainably sourced animal products (dairy, poultry, fish, etc.).
I buy organic produce (e.g. food, toiletries, cosmetics).
I buy goods and products from local or independent businesses rather than large corporations.
